resources.string: Improvider will help you to make your own musical improvisation!
How is that possible? I am not a musician!

Have you ever seen musicians improvise their solo completely? Divine inspiration? Years of work? Knowledge of thousands of music phrases? Maybe, but that\'s not everything. In fact, the main tool to improvise solos are the scales. A soloist uses a scale adapted to the backing consisting of the chords played by his fellow musicians. Many soloists can visualize that scale on their instrument. After that, they know they can play only on the keys(Piano)/buttons(Brass)/frets(guitar) etc. that they previously visualized as part of the scale. Improvider simply provides you with a playback already contained within the app, chooses a classic adapted scale and shows it to you by coloring some keys on the tactil keyboard. For the best solos, play on the green notes! Now, it\'s up to you to experiment, let your feelings express themselves, and enjoy!
Within the backing tab, you will find the controls and settings concerning the background music.
Within the Piano tab, you will find the keyboard with some keys that have been colored. These colored keys represent an adapted scale for the backing.
The idea is that by only playing on the colored keys, you can be sure it will sound good! If you need convincing, just experiment and try other keys.
Within the settings tab, it is possible to set some parameters of the keyboard.
